page.title: 09Soil content around Bourton
page.content: Most of the land in the valleys of the {River Windrush}and its tributary, the {Dikler,}is down to{pasture.}In the east the{land rises steeply}from{140 {to 240 metres}with a{spring line occurring at{210 metres. {Soil samples}taken and analysed from twelve sites over the area, six to the west of the Dikler and six to the east, show a{considerable variation}in {humus}and{moisture content. To the west of the river the{moisture {content}varied from 7.07% to 16.41% and in the east between 8.82% and 11.67%. The dampest soils were found near Moore Lane Farm, north-east of Bourton. {Humus content}varied between 5.32% on the wettest soils and 31.83% south- east of Wyck Rissington.
